# set(_:forKey:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the value of the specified key to a property list object.

## Declaration

```swift
func set(_ value: Any?, forKey defaultName: String)
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The property-list type to store in the defaults database. If you specify an array or dictionary type, those collections must similarly contain only property list types.
- **defaultName**: The key that contains the setting’s name.

## Discussion

Use this method to write property list object types to the defaults store. To store types that aren’t property list objects, archive them to a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Data] object and use this method to save that data object to the defaults store.

After you call this method, the system generates a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UserDefaults/didChangeNotification] for registered observers.

## Setting the value for a key

- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a Boolean value.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to an integer.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a floating-point number.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a double.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a URL.
